text: not as well prepared as we should be for
the common or the unexpected infectious
diseases and flu pandemics are among the
least predictable and the most
widespread of all of the infectious
diseases that spread rapidly throughout
the world those who have experienced the
2009 h1n1 pandemic may have shrugged and
said well just influenza and an
influenza pandemic is just influenza
that spreads all over the world because
it's different from the ones we've had
circulating before but they can be
devastating the most devastating one we
know was the 1918 influenza which
literally half the world's population
was infected with this virus and
probably killed about a hundred million
probably the greatest natural disaster
in history and it actually had a major
impact on World War blah in fact the
1918 flu caused the governments to
decide that they didn't have the troops
to fight anymore and would have to stop
fighting the German General Staff
actually gave that as one of their
reasons for surrender
there are so many of these infections in
nature that we haven't thought about
that we may know exist in which I think
is an interesting challenge which ones
we should really be paying attention to
